perfect clone of alone in the dark using a-frame and javascript
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Creating a perfect clone of "Alone in the Dark" is a complex task that involves intricate game mechanics, graphics, and sound design. However, I can help you create a simple 3D scene using A-Frame, which is a web framework for building virtual reality experiences. Below is a basic example of a 3D scene that you can run in a single HTML file. This example will not replicate the full game but will give you a starting point for a 3D environment.

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Simple A-Frame Scene</title>
    <style>
        body { margin: 0; }
        a-scene { height: 100vh; }
    </style>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
</head>
<body>
    <a-scene>
        <!-- Sky -->
        <a-sky color="#87CEEB"></a-sky>

        <!-- Ground -->
        <a-plane position="0 0 -5" rotation="-90 0 0" width="10" height="10" color="#7CFC00"></a-plane>

        <!-- Walls -->
        <a-box position="-5 1 -5" depth="0.1" height="2" width="10" color="#8B4513"></a-box>
        <a-box position="5 1 -5" depth="0.1" height="2" width="10" color="#8B4513"></a-box>
        <a-box position="0 1 -10" depth="10" height="2" width="0.1" color="#8B4513"></a-box>
        <a-box position="0 1 0" depth="10" height="2" width="0.1" color="#8B4513"></a-box>

        <!-- Player -->
        <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0"></a-entity>

        <!-- Light -->
        <a-light type="ambient" color="#FFFFFF"></a-light>
        <a-light type="directional" position="-1 2 1" intensity="0.5"></a-light>

        <!-- Interactive Box -->
        <a-box position="0 1 -3" depth="1" height="1" width="1" color="#FF0000" 
               event-set__enter="_event: mouseenter; color: #00FF00" 
               event-set__leave="_event: mouseleave; color: #FF0000">
        </a-box>
    </a-scene>

    <script>
        // You can add custom JavaScript here for more interactivity
    </script>
</body>
</html>
```

### Explanation:
- **A-Frame**: This framework is used to create 3D and VR experiences in the web browser.
- **Sky**: A simple blue sky is created using the `<a-sky>` element.
- **Ground**: A green plane represents the ground.
- **Walls**: Brown boxes represent walls to create a simple room-like structure.
- **Camera**: The camera is positioned at a height of 1.6 meters, simulating a first-person view.
- **Lighting**: Ambient and directional lights are added to illuminate the scene.
- **Interactive Box**: A red box changes color when the mouse hovers over it, demonstrating basic interactivity.

### How to Use:
1. Copy the code above.
2. Paste it into a new file and save it with a `.html` extension (e.g., `index.html`).
3. Open the file in a web browser that supports WebGL (most modern browsers do).

This is a very basic starting point. To create a more complex game like "Alone in the Dark," you would need to implement game mechanics, character models, animations, sound effects, and more advanced interactions.
